sources_analysed.name: Slack marketing homepage (EN-AU)
sources_analysed.description: Top-level marketing page describing Slack and entry points to getting started, pricing, features, events, and resources.

sources_analysed.name: Pricing
sources_analysed.description: Overview of Slack plans, feature tiers, and commercial details, with links to security and billing help articles.

sources_analysed.name: Agentic Platform feature page
sources_analysed.description: High-level description of Slack’s agentic collaboration capabilities, marketplace links, and AI/agent resources.

sources_analysed.name: Get Started
sources_analysed.description: Onboarding and sign-up entry points, including OAuth-based sign-in and links to legal terms and privacy policy.

sources_analysed.name: Contact Sales
sources_analysed.description: Lead capture form and regional privacy links for engaging Slack’s sales team.

sources_analysed.name: Workflow Automation feature page
sources_analysed.description: Marketing and docs links for Workflow Builder, workflow connectors, and no-code automation in Slack.

sources_analysed.name: Trust & Security overview
sources_analysed.description: Security and compliance overview with certificates (ISO, SOC, APEC), FedRAMP listings, and links to EKM and data residency content.

sources_analysed.name: Security landing (redirects to Trust & Security)
sources_analysed.description: Security entry page that points to the broader Trust & Security content and resources.

sources_analysed.name: Slack Developer Docs (root)
sources_analysed.description: Primary developer documentation, including apps, APIs, surfaces, tools, workflows, and admin sections.

sources_analysed.name: Slack AI & Agentforce developer docs
sources_analysed.description: Developer-facing documentation for AI agents, AI in Slack apps, streaming APIs, and Agentforce integration.

sources_analysed.name: Slack Resources hub
sources_analysed.description: Collections of guides, demos, and playbooks, including AI, agentic work, admin guides, and small business resources.

sources_analysed.name: Slack Help Center (root)
sources_analysed.description: End-user and admin help categories and quick guides for channels, messages, workflows, AI features, and more.

sources_analysed.name: Slack Help – Submit a Request
sources_analysed.description: Support request submission page, with links to status, help categories, and legal/privacy pages.

sources_analysed.name: Slack Help – Guide to AI features in Slack
sources_analysed.description: Help article (and related links) covering Slack AI capabilities such as summarisation, huddle notes, workflows, search, and canvases.

sources_analysed.name: Slack API – Apps AI docs
sources_analysed.description: API documentation entry point for building AI-powered Slack apps and integrations.

likely_uncovered_areas_or_ambiguities: Full content of individual help articles and API reference pages (we only saw titles and navigation links, not body text).
Details of all Slack plans, SKUs, and precise feature matrices beyond what is implied by pricing and AI FAQ links.
Complete list of workspace, org, and enterprise admin settings (authentication, retention, legal hold, mobile controls, etc.).
Full Slack Marketplace taxonomy and feature set for each third-party app or integration.
GovSlack and other regional/government-specific deployments may have additional capabilities not visible from the analysed links.
Desktop vs mobile vs web client differences, offline behaviour, and fine-grained UX workflows are not captured from these high-level docs.
assumptions_made: Article titles and URL slugs (e.g., 'What-is-a-channel', 'Use-threads-to-organize-discussions') reliably indicate the underlying product features.
Slack continues to provide channel- and DM-based messaging as core functionality consistent with long-standing product behaviour.
Links from marketing pages to docs (e.g., Workflow Builder, AI guides, Agentforce docs) reflect currently available or imminent capabilities rather than deprecated features.
Developer docs sections (e.g., 'apis/web-api', 'interactivity/implementing-slash-commands') refer to active, supported APIs.
Security and compliance links (ISO certificates, SOC reports, FedRAMP listings, GDPR page) refer to controls that are in effect for the core Slack service.

core_product_capabilities.name: Channel and Direct Message-based Collaboration
core_product_capabilities.description: Slack provides real-time messaging in channels and direct messages with support for threads, unread management, and muting to organise conversations.

main_interfaces.details: Slack desktop, web, and mobile clients showing channels, DMs, and threads.
Help center quick guides on channels, DMs, threads, and unread messages.

security_relevant_traits: Channel membership and DM visibility enforce data access boundaries within a workspace or org.
Admins can control default channels, retention, and possibly access policies (implied by admin docs).
Muting, unread views, and notifications affect which content users are likely to see but not underlying access controls.

evidence.title: Slack Help Center – Core messaging guides
evidence.summary: Help navigation includes articles such as 'What is a channel', 'Understand direct messages', 'Use threads to organize discussions', and unread/mute guides.

evidence.title: AI features guide cross-links to core messaging
evidence.summary: AI help article links to messaging help sections, confirming channels, DMs, threads, and message management as core constructs.

core_product_capabilities.name: Slack AI End-user Features
core_product_capabilities.description: Slack AI provides summarisation, writing assistance, and enterprise search capabilities embedded in channels, huddles, workflows, and canvases.

main_interfaces.details: AI controls in channels, DMs, threads, huddles, and canvases surfaced in the Slack client.
Help center AI feature guide describing user-facing AI capabilities.

key_data_involved: Messages and threads across channels and DMs
Huddle audio and transcripts (for AI huddle notes)
Enterprise search index across Slack and connected apps
security_relevant_traits: AI features may process a wide span of workspace data, increasing the blast radius of misconfigurations.
Enterprise search across applications can surface external data; configuration likely matters for scoping and access control.
Admin-controlled enablement and feature availability by plan or workspace is implied by AI FAQ and pricing links.

evidence.title: Guide to AI features in Slack
evidence.summary: Help article links to AI huddle notes, AI workflows, AI in canvases, enterprise search, and pricing/availability FAQ.

evidence.title: Slack AI marketing and pricing links
evidence.summary: Pricing page links to 'Introducing Slack AI' help articles and AI FAQ, indicating plan-based AI entitlements.

evidence.title: Resources – AI and agentic work content
evidence.summary: Resources hub includes AI-focused pieces such as '10 ways to transform your work with AI in Slack' and 'employee-facing AI agents'.

core_product_capabilities.name: Workflow Builder and No-code Workflow Automation
core_product_capabilities.description: Slack offers a Workflow Builder for non-technical users to automate routine tasks using triggers, steps, and connectors to other systems.

main_interfaces.details: Workflow Builder interface in the Slack client (launch workflows, add steps, configure triggers).
Help article on creating new workflows and adding steps.
Resources collection for Workflow Builder best practices.

key_data_involved: User inputs collected by workflow forms or messages
Events and payloads from third-party connectors
Run history and possibly logs of executions
security_relevant_traits: Workflows can automate actions across channels, users, and external systems, representing configurable business logic.
Permissions of the workflow owner or app backing the workflow determine what operations can be performed.
Misconfigured workflows could leak or transform data across channels or external apps; admin controls and monitoring are important.

evidence.title: Workflow Automation feature page
evidence.summary: Feature page links to Workflow Builder resources, API docs, and blog posts about conditional branching and connectors.

evidence.title: Workflow Builder help and docs
evidence.summary: Developer docs reference workflows, comparison of workflows vs apps, and custom steps in Bolt SDKs.

core_product_capabilities.name: Canvases and Rich Surfaces for Knowledge Capture
core_product_capabilities.description: Slack provides canvases and other rich surfaces to capture structured content, notes, and documentation, with AI-assisted authoring.

main_interfaces.details: Canvas editing surface in the Slack client.
Help article on using AI to write or edit content in a canvas.

security_relevant_traits: Canvas visibility and sharing control who can read or edit potentially long-form sensitive content.
AI features can summarise or transform canvas content, possibly exposing key information to different audiences.
Canvases may become a secondary knowledge store alongside messages, affecting retention and e-discovery.

evidence.title: Slack Developer Docs – Surfaces and canvases
evidence.summary: Surfaces documentation includes 'canvases' as a supported UI surface for apps.

evidence.title: AI features guide – Canvases section
evidence.summary: AI features guide links to an article on using AI to write or edit content in canvases.

core_product_capabilities.name: Enterprise Search Across Slack and Connected Applications
core_product_capabilities.description: Slack supports enterprise search that can query content across Slack and integrated applications, enhanced by AI to surface answers.

main_interfaces.details: Search bar and AI search interfaces in Slack clients.
Help article on searching across applications with enterprise search.
Help article on setting up and managing Slack enterprise search.

key_data_involved: Indexed messages, files, and canvas content
Metadata and content from connected third-party apps
User search queries and result-click behaviours
security_relevant_traits: Search may surface data from multiple systems, so access control and index scoping are critical.
Admins configure which sources are searchable and how results are filtered per user permissions.
Search logs may contain sensitive queries that should be treated as telemetry data.

evidence.title: AI features guide – Enterprise search references
evidence.summary: AI help article links to enterprise search setup and cross-app search guidance.

evidence.title: Resources – From searching to finding
evidence.summary: Resources hub includes content like 'From searching to finding: the new era of AI-powered enterprise knowledge'.

core_product_capabilities.name: Agentic Collaboration and Embedded AI Agents
core_product_capabilities.description: Slack enables agentic workflows using AI agents (including Salesforce Agentforce) operating inside channels and surfaces to assist with work.
primary_actors: Admins managing access and integration settings

main_interfaces.details: Agent interactions in channels and other Slack surfaces (agent responses, suggested actions).
Agentic platform marketing page with examples and marketplace agent listings.
Developer docs for AI agents and Agentforce integration in Slack.
Salesforce Agentforce configuration and docs.

key_data_involved: Workspace and channel context passed to agents
External business data accessed via Salesforce or other backends
security_relevant_traits: Agents can act on behalf of users or orgs, so their permissions and action set must be tightly controlled.
Cross-system data access (Slack plus Salesforce and others) increases integration risk.
Admins may need explicit controls to restrict which agents can be installed or used in which workspaces/channels.

evidence.title: Agentic Platform feature page
evidence.summary: Highlights Slack’s agentic collaboration story, with marketplace links for agent apps and an AI agents contact sales path.

evidence.title: Slack AI developer docs – agents in Slack
evidence.summary: Docs include sections like 'What is an agent', 'Use cases', and 'Agents in Salesforce', referencing Agentforce and custom Slack actions.

administrative_and_operational_capabilit.name: Plan Management, Billing, and Discounts
administrative_and_operational_capabilit.description: Admins can select Slack plans, manage billing cycles and payment methods, and apply for nonprofit or education discounts.

main_interfaces.details: Pricing page with plan comparison and CTAs to start trials or contact sales.
Help articles on supported payment methods, fair billing, and changing billing cycles.
Help center discounts for nonprofits and education.

security_relevant_traits: Billing admins effectively control plan features such as Slack AI availability and enterprise security options.
Changes to plan or billing cycles may affect data retention or compliance-related functionality.
Discount application flows may collect organisation validation documents or attestations.

evidence.title: Pricing page links to billing help
evidence.summary: Lists links to help articles for payment methods, billing cycles, fair billing, and nonprofit/education discounts.

administrative_and_operational_capabilit.name: Workspace and Organisation Administration
administrative_and_operational_capabilit.description: Admins manage workspace settings, users, channels, and features, guided by dedicated admin resources and help categories.

main_interfaces.details: Admin controls within Slack clients (workspace and org settings) implied by help content.
Help Center admin categories and quick guides.
Resources collection 'Slack for admins' and guides like 'Complete guide to launching Channel Expert'.
Developer docs for admins, including app and workflow governance.

key_data_involved: User accounts, roles, and group memberships
security_relevant_traits: Admin operations are highly privileged and include governance over authentication, apps, workflows, and possibly retention.
Channel Expert and similar features may give admins new levers to shape how employees consume information.
Admin docs likely define how to configure and audit app and workflow usage.

evidence.title: Help Center categories and quick guides
evidence.summary: Navigation includes admin-oriented sections and quick guides for configuring core Slack behaviour.

evidence.title: Slack Developer Docs – Admins
evidence.summary: Developer docs contain a dedicated admins section, implying admin-specific controls and APIs.

evidence.title: Resources – Slack for admins
evidence.summary: Resources hub links to an admin-focused guide for launching Channel Expert.

administrative_and_operational_capabilit.name: Security, Compliance, and Enterprise Key Management
administrative_and_operational_capabilit.description: Slack provides enterprise security and compliance features, including certifications, data residency, and enterprise key management.

main_interfaces.details: Trust & Security overview site detailing certifications and security posture.
Enterprise Key Management info and security resources.
Data residency announcements and GDPR page.

key_data_involved: Customer content protected by encryption at rest and in transit
Encryption keys (including customer-managed keys for EKM)
security_relevant_traits: Slack publishes ISO 27001/27017/27018, APEC, SOC 3, FedRAMP, IRAP and other attestations, indicating strong formal security controls.
Enterprise Key Management implies customer control over encryption keys and access to key usage logs.
Data residency options and GDPR alignment affect where data is stored and how it is processed.

evidence.title: Trust & Security overview
evidence.summary: Lists ISO, SOC 3, APEC certifications, FedRAMP listings, IRAP and other cloud security references, plus links to EKM and security resources.

evidence.title: Security at Slack resource
evidence.summary: Security resource linked from Trust & Security highlights how Slack protects customer data.

evidence.title: Enterprise Key Management
evidence.summary: Linked from Trust & Security as part of advanced security capabilities.

administrative_and_operational_capabilit.name: Support, Incident Management, and Status
administrative_and_operational_capabilit.description: Slack operates a help center, support request system, and status page to handle incidents and user support.

main_interfaces.details: Help Center with searchable articles and contact options.
Support request submission page that requires sign-in to submit workspace-specific cases.
Service status page for real-time and historical incident reporting.

key_data_involved: Workspace and user identifiers associated with requests
security_relevant_traits: Support flows may access sensitive workspace context and must enforce appropriate authentication.
Status and incident information may reveal operational details but is also critical for transparency.
Support channels are a vector for social engineering; internal processes and verification steps are implied but not detailed here.

evidence.title: Help – Submit a request
evidence.summary: Support page links to status, help categories, and legal/privacy documents and requires workspace sign-in.

evidence.title: Slack Help Center root
evidence.summary: Help center navigation references the status page and multiple support categories.

administrative_and_operational_capabilit.name: Legal, Privacy, and Regional Compliance Operations
administrative_and_operational_capabilit.description: Slack exposes legal terms, privacy policies, and regional compliance notices, often via Salesforce legal pages for the combined platform.

main_interfaces.details: Slack main services agreement, user terms, and supplemental terms linked from onboarding.
Slack privacy policy and cookie policy.
Salesforce regional privacy pages linked from the Contact Sales form.

key_data_involved: Contractual terms and data processing commitments
security_relevant_traits: Legal and privacy docs define how Slack handles personal data and security responsibilities.
Regional Salesforce privacy pages confirm shared or delegated obligations within the Salesforce ecosystem.
Changes to these documents can have compliance impact across all other capabilities.

evidence.title: Get started – legal and privacy links
evidence.summary: Onboarding page links to main services agreement, user terms, supplemental terms, privacy policy, and cookie policy.

evidence.title: Contact Sales – Salesforce privacy links
evidence.summary: Contact form page includes Salesforce regional privacy and personal information pages.

api_surface_and_integrations.name: Slack App Platform – Web API and Surfaces
api_surface_and_integrations.description: Slack exposes APIs and UI surfaces for building apps that send messages, present interfaces, and respond to events.

main_interfaces.details: Web API methods for interacting with Slack programmatically.
Surfaces docs for messages, modals, app home, canvases, and split-view.
Block Kit reference for composing interactive messages.

key_data_involved: Context payloads for surfaces and views
security_relevant_traits: Apps hold tokens with scopes that determine which data they can access or modify.
Block Kit surfaces can request user input and trigger app-side workflows.
Admins typically control app installation, distribution, and permissions.

evidence.title: Slack Developer Docs – Apps and APIs
evidence.summary: Root developer docs link to apps, surfaces, messaging, Block Kit, authentication, and Web API references.

api_surface_and_integrations.name: Events API, Slash Commands, and Interactivity
api_surface_and_integrations.description: Slack provides an Events API, shortcuts, slash commands, and interactive components for real-time app-driven workflows.
primary_actors: End users triggering commands and shortcuts

main_interfaces.details: Events API delivering workspace events to app endpoints.
Interactivity docs for implementing shortcuts and slash commands.

key_data_involved: Event payloads describing messages, reactions, and user actions
Interaction payloads from message buttons, menus, and modals
security_relevant_traits: Events API requires secure endpoint handling, verification tokens or signatures, and potentially rate limiting.
Slash commands can trigger privileged actions; their names and availability must be governed.
Interactive payloads must be validated to avoid spoofing or replay attacks.

evidence.title: Slack Developer Docs – Interactivity and events
evidence.summary: AI docs link back to interactivity and events API documentation, showing use of shortcuts, slash commands, and events in AI agents.

evidence.title: Slack Developer Docs – Events API
evidence.summary: Developer documentation for receiving events from Slack.

api_surface_and_integrations.name: Workflow Automation APIs and Custom Steps
api_surface_and_integrations.description: Developers can extend Workflow Builder with custom steps and programmatic workflows using Slack SDKs and APIs.

main_interfaces.details: Developer docs for comparing workflows and apps and building custom workflow steps.
Bolt SDK docs for custom steps in Python, JS, and Java.

key_data_involved: Input and output payloads between steps
Tokens and credentials for external systems invoked by workflows
security_relevant_traits: Custom steps can perform arbitrary operations; their implementation must handle input validation and secrets securely.
Admin control over which apps can provide custom steps is critical to prevent untrusted automation.
Custom steps executed in workflows may run under elevated app scopes.

evidence.title: Slack Developer Docs – Workflows and custom steps
evidence.summary: Docs include workflow vs app comparisons and custom step guides for Bolt SDKs.

evidence.title: Workflow Automation feature page – connectors
evidence.summary: Feature page links to workflow connectors and examples of integrating with systems like DocuSign and other tools.

api_surface_and_integrations.name: AI and Agentforce Developer Platform
api_surface_and_integrations.description: Slack exposes APIs and patterns for building AI-powered apps and Agentforce agents, including streaming chat APIs and specialised Block Kit components.
primary_actors: Admins approving AI apps and agents

main_interfaces.details: AI app docs and patterns.
AI developer docs covering agents, use cases, and AI features.
Streaming chat methods for incremental responses.
Specialised Block Kit elements for feedback and actions in AI interactions.

key_data_involved: Model outputs and intermediate streaming tokens
Telemetry like feedback button clicks and user ratings
Agent configuration and mapping to underlying models or Salesforce actions
security_relevant_traits: Streaming APIs must secure long-lived connections and protect against prompt injection and data exfiltration.
Feedback and action buttons may update model configuration or escalate issues; integrity is important.
Agentforce integration implies cross-domain trust between Salesforce and Slack tenants.

evidence.title: Slack AI developer docs – streaming and blocks
evidence.summary: Lists chat.startstream/chat.appendstream/chat.stopstream methods and AI-specific Block Kit elements like feedback buttons.

evidence.title: Slack API – AI apps docs
evidence.summary: API docs entry point for building AI-powered Slack apps.

api_surface_and_integrations.name: Slack App Marketplace and Third-party Integrations
api_surface_and_integrations.description: Slack hosts a marketplace of first- and third-party apps integrating tools like Asana, Miro, Notion, PagerDuty, AWS Chatbot, Box, and ChatGPT.
primary_actors: End users installing or using apps
App developers publishing to the marketplace

main_interfaces.details: Slack App Marketplace listing apps and categories, including 'agents & assistants'.
Individual marketplace listings for apps like Asana, Miro, Notion, AWS Chatbot, PagerDuty, Box, and ChatGPT.
Install and configuration flows accessible from within Slack or the marketplace.

key_data_involved: Events and data exchanged between Slack and external systems
security_relevant_traits: Marketplace apps can access Slack data and external systems, creating complex trust relationships.
Admins typically control which apps can be installed and where they can operate.
Agents & assistants category may include apps that autonomously perform actions on behalf of users or orgs.

evidence.title: Agentic Platform page – marketplace integrations
evidence.summary: Lists marketplace apps such as Perplexity, Writer, Dropbox Dash, Asana, ChatGPT, Box, PagerDuty, and AWS Chatbot.

evidence.title: Slack Developer Docs – Marketplace link
evidence.summary: Developer docs link to the marketplace for distribution of Slack apps.

background_jobs_and_automation.name: Workflow Execution and Scheduling Engine
background_jobs_and_automation.description: Slack runs workflows configured in Workflow Builder and via APIs, triggering steps based on events, schedules, or user actions.
primary_actors: End users and admins who define workflows

main_interfaces.details: Workflow Builder configuration interface where triggers and steps are defined.
Workflow- and automation-related API endpoints and Bolt SDK support.

security_relevant_traits: Background execution under app or workflow identities can modify data without interactive user action.
Error handling and logging may expose sensitive data if not properly redacted.
Misconfigured schedules or triggers can cause repeated or unintended automated actions.

evidence.title: Workflow Automation feature page
evidence.summary: Highlights automated workflows and links to resources on branching and connectors.

evidence.title: Workflow docs – custom steps and comparison with apps
evidence.summary: Indicates a distinct workflow engine and integration points with apps.

background_jobs_and_automation.name: Notification and Alert Delivery from Integrations
background_jobs_and_automation.description: Slack delivers automated notifications from integrated systems like PagerDuty, AWS Chatbot, and other marketplace apps into channels.
primary_actors: End users consuming alerts in channels

main_interfaces.details: Marketplace integrations for alerting tools such as PagerDuty and AWS Chatbot.

security_relevant_traits: Alert content may include sensitive operational or customer data.
Apps must authenticate to external systems and Slack and may act on alerts (e.g., ack, escalate).
Multi-tenant apps must ensure alerts are delivered only to the correct workspaces.

evidence.title: Agentic Platform and marketplace links
evidence.summary: Lists integrations such as PagerDuty and AWS Chatbot, indicating automated messaging into Slack.

background_jobs_and_automation.name: AI Indexing, Summarisation, and Search Pipelines
background_jobs_and_automation.description: Slack likely runs background jobs to index content, generate AI embeddings, and maintain search indices for AI and enterprise search.
primary_actors: End users indirectly through searches and AI usage

main_interfaces.details: Search and AI experiences that depend on pre-computed indices.

key_data_involved: Workspace messages, files, and canvas content
security_relevant_traits: Background processing touches large volumes of data, making segmentation and access control critical.
Index contents must respect retention and legal hold policies.
AI processing may be subject to regional data residency and encryption controls described in security docs.

evidence.title: AI features and enterprise search help
evidence.summary: Cross-app search implies indexing and aggregation of external content.

evidence.title: Trust & Security – data residency and encryption
evidence.summary: Data residency and encryption references imply careful handling of background-processed data.

background_jobs_and_automation.notes: Some details (e.g., specific indexing architectures) are inferred from the presence of enterprise search and AI features.

background_jobs_and_automation.name: Security Monitoring and Compliance Reporting
background_jobs_and_automation.description: Slack maintains continuous security monitoring and generates compliance reports and attestations, including SOC and ISO reports.

main_interfaces.details: Downloads for SOC 3 reports, ISO certificates, and other security attestations.

security_relevant_traits: Security monitoring is a privileged operation affecting the entire multi-tenant service.
Published reports must accurately reflect security posture and may be used in customer risk assessments.
Monitoring and audit data handling must itself meet stringent protection standards.

evidence.title: Trust & Security – certificates and reports
evidence.summary: Page links to ISO 27001/27017/27018 certificates, SOC 3 reports, and other assessments.

services_or_modules.name: Core Collaboration Service
services_or_modules.description: Multi-tenant backend that manages workspaces, channels, DMs, threads, and message storage.

services_or_modules.name: Workflow Builder and Automation Engine
services_or_modules.description: Service that stores and executes workflows defined via Workflow Builder or APIs.

services_or_modules.name: Slack AI and Agent Services
services_or_modules.description: Services providing summarisation, search, and agentic functionality, including integration with Salesforce Agentforce.

services_or_modules.name: Slack App Platform and APIs
services_or_modules.description: Web API, Events API, interactivity, and surfaces components enabling third-party and custom apps.

services_or_modules.name: Help Center and Support Portal
services_or_modules.description: Web properties serving documentation, support articles, and request submission flows.

storage_and_logs.name: Message and File Storage
storage_and_logs.description: Persistent storage for messages, threads, files, and canvas content governed by data residency and encryption controls.

storage_and_logs.name: Workflow Definitions and Execution Logs
storage_and_logs.description: Stores workflow configurations, run history, and execution outcomes.

storage_and_logs.name: Search Indexes and AI Embeddings
storage_and_logs.description: Search indices for Slack content and connected apps along with AI-specific representations.

storage_and_logs.name: Security and Compliance Logs
storage_and_logs.description: Telemetry and logs used for SOC/ISO reporting and operational monitoring.

external_systems.name: Salesforce Platform and Agentforce
external_systems.description: Underlying CRM and AI agent platform integrated into Slack for agentic workflows and Copilot-style functionality.

external_systems.name: Third-party SaaS Integrations
external_systems.description: Tools like Asana, Miro, Notion, PagerDuty, AWS Chatbot, ZoomInfo, Box, Dropbox Dash, and ChatGPT integrated via the marketplace.

external_systems.name: Compliance and Certification Bodies
external_systems.description: ISO, FedRAMP marketplace, CSA STAR, regional assessors (IRAP, ISMAP, etc.) referenced in Trust & Security docs.

data_flows.name: User Messaging and Collaboration Flow
data_flows.description: Users send messages and files to channels and DMs; Slack processes and stores them; AI and search services index content.

data_flows.name: Workflow and Automation Flow
data_flows.description: Events, schedules, or user actions trigger workflows that may call internal APIs or external integrations.

data_flows.name: AI and Agent Interaction Flow
data_flows.description: User prompts and context are sent to AI/agent services, which may call external systems (e.g., Salesforce) and respond in Slack surfaces.

data_flows.name: Support and Incident Flow
data_flows.description: Users submit support requests via the help portal; Slack support handles and may reference logs, status, and configuration data.

privileged_operations: Workspace and org administration, including control over authentication, app installation, and workflow governance.
Configuration of enterprise security features like Enterprise Key Management, data residency, and compliance settings.
Agentforce and AI agent configuration, determining which agents exist and what data and actions they can access.
Billing and plan management, which indirectly controls access to advanced features such as Slack AI and enterprise security options.
user_configurable_logic: Workflow Builder allows end users and admins to define multi-step automations using internal and external actions.
Custom workflow steps implemented via Bolt SDKs let developers introduce arbitrary logic into user-defined workflows.
Slash commands, shortcuts, and interactive elements let teams encode domain-specific flows triggered by everyday user actions.
AI features (e.g., summarisation, search scope, agent configuration) may be partially configurable by admins or team owners.
auth_and_identity_behaviours: Slack supports OAuth-based sign-in (e.g., with Apple) and links to main services agreement and user terms at account creation.
Workspace sign-in is required to submit support requests tied to a workspace, indicating auth checks on help flows.
Apps authenticate via OAuth and tokens as described in developer docs, with scopes granting granular API access.
Agentforce integration implies cross-identity mapping between Salesforce users and Slack users or workspaces.
logging_and_audit_behaviours: Trust & Security pages reference SOC 3 and ISO audits, which require robust logging and monitoring of security events.
Enterprise Key Management typically provides key usage logging to customers for auditing data access.
Workflow and automation systems likely log execution results and errors to support debugging and compliance.
Support and status systems record incidents and requests, providing an operational audit trail.
failure_modes: Slack-status.com indicates a model where service incidents and degradations are publicly reported.
Help center and support request flows provide a mechanism for users to report issues and receive remediation.
Workflows and integrations may fail due to external service outages; error handling is implied but not fully documented in the analysed links.
AI features and enterprise search may degrade gracefully (e.g., limited or no AI responses) when indexing or AI services are unavailable.

open_questions.question: What are the exact feature and data-access differences between each Slack plan (including Slack AI entitlements) beyond the pricing page hints?
open_questions.context: Pricing page links to AI FAQ and help articles, but full matrices were not accessible from link listings alone.

open_questions.question: How precisely can admins scope and govern AI agents (Agentforce and others) at the workspace, channel, and user levels?
open_questions.context: Agentforce and AI agent docs are linked but their detailed configuration and permission models were not visible from link lists.
related_capabilities: Agentic Collaboration and Embedded AI Agents

open_questions.question: What configuration and monitoring options exist for Workflow Builder executions (e.g., rate limiting, guardrails, approval workflows)?
open_questions.context: Workflow Builder docs list creation and custom steps but do not expose deeper governance capabilities via the analysed links.
related_capabilities: Workflow Builder and No-code Workflow Automation

open_questions.question: What are the full admin and API capabilities for managing apps and workflows at enterprise scale (org-wide policies, allowlists, audit exports)?
open_questions.context: Developer docs include an admins section and workflows vs apps comparison, but detailed enterprise governance docs are not visible.
related_capabilities: Slack App Platform – Web API and Surfaces
